wikipedia_page.main: Austen Harry Albu (21 September 1903 – 23 November 1994) was a British Labour Member of Parliament for Edmonton.

Secretary of State for Economic Affairs

response: After settling in Reading at the end of the war he was selected by the local Constituency Labour Party for the 1945 general election, beating James Callaghan and Austen Albu. On every topic, the National Health Service, education, social deprivation, nationalisation or socialism, he was seen as an inspiration to others. Mik, as he introduced himself, showed he had planned where he was going and the constituency members wanted to go with him. His integrity was obvious and beguiling, quite rare amongst professional politicians.

In 1927 she married Paul Felix Lazarsfeld with whom she had her only child Lotte Franziska Lazarsfeld (born 1930)- who became a professor of management at M.I.T.. In 1934, she divorced Lazarsfeld, who had been involved with Herta Herzog since 1932. After she returned to the UK in 1958 she married the Labour politician Austen Albu.

link_mentions.page: List of MPs elected in the 1951 United Kingdom general election

response: * Austen Albu (1903 – 1994), former British Labour Member of Parliament for Edmonton (UK Parliament constituency), former Minister of State for Economic Affairs, lived in The Crescent, Keymer, with his wife, social psychologist Marie Jahoda (1907–2001).

link_mentions.page: List of MPs elected in the 1970 United Kingdom general election

response: *Austen Albu was appointed Minister of State for Economic Affairs in the UK government by Prime Minister Harold Wilson.
